doc.after: Mangalore's economy is dominated by the industrial, commercial, agricultural processing and port-related activities.[74] The New Mangalore Port is India's eighth largest port, in terms of cargo handling. It handles 75 per cent of India's coffee exports and the bulk of its cashew nuts.[5] During 2000â01, Mangalore generated a revenue of â¹33.47 crore (US$5.31Â million) to the state.[75] The city's major enterprises include Mangalore Chemicals and Fertilizers Ltd. (MCF), Kudremukh Iron Ore Company Ltd. (KIOCL), Mangalore Refinery and Petrochemicals Ltd. (MRPL), BASF, Bharati Shipyard Limited and Total Oil India Limited (ELF Gas).
